meanings.definition: In a luxurious or self-indulgent manner.
meanings.sent1: She ate the chocolate cake decadently, savoring every bite.
meanings.sent2: The rich chocolate melted decadently in her mouth.
meanings.sent3: He smiled decadently as he enjoyed the warm sun on his face.
meanings.sent4: The music flowed through the room decadently, filling every corner with its melody.
meanings.sent5: The velvet curtains hung decadently, adding a touch of elegance to the room.

meanings.definition: Characterized by moral or cultural decline.
meanings.sent1: The decadently lavish party was a display of excess and opulence.
meanings.sent2: The decadently decorated room exuded an air of luxury and extravagance.
meanings.sent3: The decadently dressed man raised eyebrows at the formal event.
meanings.sent4: The decadently decaying building stood as a reminder of past grandeur.
meanings.sent5: The decadently painted artwork captured the essence of a bygone era.
